lead_paragraph: Mr. Obama’s trip represents the start of a new era of engagement between the United States and Cuba, but it also underscores the countries’ deep disagreements.

headline.print_headline: Cuba Is Set to Embrace Obama, but U.S. Goals May Get Colder Greeting
headline.main: Obama Hopes Cuba Visit Can Be Harbinger of Political Change

snippet: Mr. Obama’s trip represents the start of a new era of engagement between the United States and Cuba, but it also underscores the countries’ deep disagreements.
abstract: Cubans prepare to welcome Pres Obama, despite lingering suspicion and little concrete change in American policy towards Cuba after recent reopening of diplomatic ties; Pres Obama is intent on promoting freedom and democracy during visit, but critics cite Raul Castro regime's ongoing human rights abuses in suggesting that expectations may be naive.
